ovdesc.p: This table contains all the Local Stock Exchange Commissions and Fees as payable on the GERMAN stock exchange.

It contains standard default Category and Transaction codes for all P & L related entries as well as the various bands at which different percentages are to be applied and the asset type to which those rates refer.

Additionally, it allows the user to store whenever possible the minimum charges payable within that specified stock exchange. It must be pointed out that whereas the system is completely flexible regarding the different levels and rates applicable - a change in the fundamental calculation process would inevitably lead to a program change.

desc.p: Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 23 & 24 to store the rates applicable on a foreign charge payable on the German Stock Exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default rate to be used when calculating a client's brokerage on a transaction in shares traded on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Standard default value for a clients' minimum charge payable on any bond transaction dealt in the German exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point.
Default credit transaction code for all foreign charges levied from a customer according to the calculations contained within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Specifies the country domicile to which the rates and commissions applicable within any particular stock exchange apply.

Notes: At stock exchange the user is prompted for a (CALL.COUNTRY) ID at field 3. Whenever a transaction is entered with a given stock exchange the system will read the appropriate stock exchange calculation tables.
It is possible to have 2 or more stock exchanges reading the same calculation table e.g. Basle, Geneva and Zurich.
2 type SS (Uppercase alpha) country code characters. (Mandatory Input).
Must exist on the COUNTRY.CODE table.
Contains the default value for calculating the brokerage payable on a bond purchase or sale on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point.
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with fields 23 & 25 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign charges as calculated within this application.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default debit transaction code for all commission levied from a customer under this particular application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
Default category code for all foreign charges levied from a customer within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Default category code for all client commission type entries contained within the application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
Default rate to be applied on all transactions in shares when traded on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default credit transaction code for all commission levied from a client under this particular application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Standard default value for all client commission calculated under this routine i.e. on trades executed in the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default credit transaction code for all foreign charges levied within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Default minimum foreign charge on shares traded on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
No input field. Field automatically defaults to currency of the country as specified at ID.
3 type CCY (Currency code) characters. (Default value).
Default debit transaction code for all client entries automatically generated within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
This contains the standard default values for all client brokerage type P & L entries contained within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
This field contains the standard default minimum brokerage charge for bonds and shares traded on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default credit transaction code for all client entries automatically generated within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Standard default minimum charge payable by a client dealing in shares on the German Stock Exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default category code for all foreign charge type entries contained within these tables.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Default debit transaction code for all foreign charges levied from a customer and contained within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Default commission rate. Rate payable on all net transactions carried out on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default value for the calculation of a brokers foreign charge on shares traded on the German stock exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with fields 24 and 25 to store the different levels and rates applicable on a broker's foreign charges calculated within this application.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default debit transaction code for all foreign charges levied from a client and calculated within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Contains the default rate applied by the broker on all transactions in bonds traded on the German Stock Exchange.
1-14 type AMT (Stand Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default category code for all brokerage type entries contained within these tables.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
Credit transaction code for all brokerage P & L type entries which will be created by this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Debit transaction code for all brokerage type P & L entries created within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
